reviewText: This was a great workout, but like his other dvd. This one has an annoying guy in back that keeps stopping. So unmotivating!! But Bob does great job and so do the ladies in video.
Title: N/A

reviewText: This DVD includes an hour long cardio session and a 20 minute lower body session.  The cardio session is honestly the most intense workout I've ever done.  It incorporates exercises like jumping jacks and jumping rope with other methods like kettlebell swings (done with dumbells).  It pushes you further than you ever thought you could go.  If this doesn't get you ripped fast, nothing will.I also recommend the other DVDs in this series -- Pure Burn Super Strength and Yoga for the Warrior.
Title: N/A

reviewText: This 'cardio' workout is not what you might think. I expected mostly jumping and burpees. While it's there, this is actually a high intensity interval workout with weights. There are also a lot of kettlebell swings. All moves are done to the point where you just can't do no more and basically no rest which is tough. Sure, you can modify, but if you follow it exactly, you will be cooking. There are 3 exercisers each performing at a different level (they are all in great shape, no Biggest Loser stuff here). Bob doesn't actually work out (I wish he would), instead he acts as your instructor and is very pushy, but the intro and concept is good. He tells you that this workout is for your heart which is the most important muscle in your body. It got me motivated to work as hard as I could. There is also a separate shorter workout on this DVD. I also tried one of his other new ones (Pure Burn Super Strength) and didn't like it as much as this one. Great advanced workout!
Title: N/A

reviewText: Bob may be a little behind Jillian in "branding" himself as a DVD trainer, but he does not disappoint. This is a good, solid workout. Yes, it is long. And, as another reviewer mentioned, it is not one I will do more than once or twice a week. However, it will make you sweat. As someone with bad knees (old cheerleading injuries), I wish he would have more modifications. The plyo jumps and walkouts into push-ups are extremely hard for those with bad knees. Overall, I think this a good workout to have in your libarary.
summary: A Very Good, Very Tough Workout
Title: N/A

reviewText: I've been seriously working out for about the last year after experiencing a health issue. When winter came in my state I knew I needed a good indoor workout so the pounds wouldn't come piling back on. After reading some of the other reviews I decided to give this one a shot. "INTENSE" is probably the midlest way to describe it! I had been exercising six days a week, doing roughly 35 to 45 minutes of cardio, aerobics, weights, regular outside walking, and ab training. I had already lost @45 pounds and thought I was in fairly good shape for my age (almost 50). Boy, did this DVD correct my perceptions! I couldn't even finish the 60 minute workout the first few times I tried it. Now I can but I feel it afterwards. I like to alternate this with Harvey Walden's "Celebrity Fit Club" 50-minute workout to get in three or four tough workouts every week. If you want a good no-nonsense yet productive workout that will leave you sweat-drenched and thinking Bob is evil (just kidding-he's great!) buy this one.
summary: Not a wimpy sparkly workout by any means
Title: N/A

reviewText: Excellent dvd.  Bought this based on reviews of other persons.  I do exercise six times per week, and like a workout that gets your heart rate up and pushes you to the max.  This does just that.  Some of the moves are difficult but eventually you will build your fitness level to be able to do it, until then do the easier version of the move.  Glad I bought it.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I purchased this after reading reviews about it from Amazon customers - and I am SO glad I did. The workout is repetitive (the first 1/2 hour), but I think that's why it is effective, you achieve "muscle burnout" from the repetition and really feel the burn! SO glad I purchased, burned almost 400 calories in 60 minutes. 525 burned when I do the full 90 minutes!
Title: N/A

reviewText: This video is much harder than I expected. A really good workout for all levels. Bob can be a little annoying, but because it is such a good workout I can overlook it! Worth the money!
Title: N/A

reviewText: very good workout for someone that is already quite advance. Bob make you sweat, highly recommend this to keep. Thanks Bob.
Title: N/A

reviewText: It's difficult to rate this one....I DID get a good workout and I did sweat, but there were actually more weighted exercises than strictly cardio, which was fine, but not what was expected.  The swings that were done I recognized from some of my kettlebell workouts, so instead of using one weight I used a 12# kettlebell.  I am not sure if I missed it, but I didn't hear him ever say what type of weight constituted heavier and lighter.  The box says 1-2 lb. hand weights, but that is surely not what they were using.  So, the hour long kicked my butt & made me sweat, as promised.  I am a daily exerciser who does a variety of workouts, pilates, yoga, kickboxing, dance etc. and I felt when I finished that I had really worked out.  Today, I am a little sore from the squats and swings we did but it's a good sore. The 20 minute workout is light-you are doing balance and toning more than you are actually doing "cardio".  I enjoyed that one, but paired it with another workout to get in my exercise for the day.Here are the likes: Lots of squats and weighted exercises along with the cardio to help you burn fat faster.  A stripped down set with music that does not seem too loud or soft.  A timer at the bottom of the screen showing how much time you have left.Dislikes: I've done some earlier Biggest Loser dvds and don't remember Bob being quite so....I don't know, mean?  He is really a bit over the top with the aggression on this one.  The exercisers look like they are going to either cry or throw up.  When one starts to come out of squat early to shake out her legs Bob promptly goes over and sticks his knee on her back to hold her down.  A little too drill sergeant for me. Don't get me wrong, I want to workout well and hard, but I don't really enjoy this approach and that is a personal thing for me.Overall, a goodwork out for a more advanced exerciser, but less cardio than I expected and more weighted exercises.  I borrowed this copy and though I did get a good workout I have decided not to purchase it, mainly due to the zero "fun" factor. I have to feel like it is something that I like enough to put in a weekly rotation and that I would be motivated to do.  I don't think this is it.  Though I don't like a chirpy instructor, the agressive style he has in this dvd just put me off and I can't see myself being motivated to do this over and over.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I have most of Bob and Jillians workout DVD's.  This is by far the most difficult.  I feel that it is an hour well spent and feel like I have literally "climbed a mountain".  I workout 5 days a week and consider myself intermediale/advanced.  I do not have 1 hour every day to work out so therefore I will only do it once or twice at most a week.  Also, please be careful with the amount of weight used on the kettle type swings.  Start out slow, as I injured myself the first time and had to not do it for a couple of weeks.  I agree with another review - It is not fun and very repetitive so that may also be another reason I will only do it once or twice a week.  I try to do different workouts every day so this will be one of my long days.  I recommed it with a Please be careful warning.
Title: N/A

reviewText: So I'm in my early 40's and as the title says, I'm a P90X and Insanity graduate.  I've also done numerous other DVD workouts.  And when I say numerous, I'm talking all the way from original TaeBo (VHS mind you), to the more recent Jillian Ripped in 30 and just about everything in between.Based on my experience with these workouts, this is just as hard as any of the Insanity workouts. Yes, even including the Plyometrics one.In this 60 minute brutality fest, you start out with 15 minutes of single weight work.  Squats, swinging squats, dead lifts, suitcase swings...you name it, you're doing it.  Doesn't sound tough, but use a 15 lb weight and get back to me on it.  After that, it's pretty much game on...your heart will feel like it is coming out of your chest.  It's so crazy, my brain has apparently blacked out the rest of the routine because I just finished and am having a hard time remembering everything I did!Yah, he has 3 ridiculously in shape people also in the video and guess what?  He beats them into the ground.  I mean literally pounds them down.  At one point he asks if you can feel it in your legs and one woman says no.  BIG mistake.  He was on her like fly on stink.  Yep, her legs were shaking and he wasn't let her off the hook.There is absolutely now doubt that this DVD will push even the most hard core workout groupies out there.  The only other DVD that forced me to use a towel because of the sweat flying off my body was Insanity...until Bob's workout.  You will need a towel to ebb the flow of sweat pouring from your skin.The workout has a countdown timer visible throughout the regimen which I enjoy.  It displays what you are doing.  The only downside is that I saw only one official "water break" on it for the whole hour.  Trust me, you will need more.Easily, and I mean easily worth every penny you spend for this.
summary: Ridiculously hard...even for an Insanity and P90X graduate!
Title: N/A

reviewText: If you like Jillian Michaels' and Jari Love's workouts, I think you'll like this workout from Bob as well.  The choreography is extremely simple, you burn A LOT of calories, and this really improves your stamina quickly.  This video is a little tougher than Banish Fat Boost Metabolism, because it goes for 60+ minutes, and is about the same difficulty level as Get Extremely Ripped 1000.The other reviews cover most of it.  I'll just add that this workout really, really works your core and does so a little differently than Jillian Michaels' videos, so it is a nice complement.  It also helps strengthen your lower back and kills your shoulders.
Title: N/A

reviewText: There is a low-rating reviewer who had pointed out that this DVD did not appear much like a cardio workout, and I agree.  I am used to feeling like my heart will come out of my throat when doing cardio by doing lots of plyometrics and jumping around.  This DVD is not what I have in mind when I think of cardio workouts.  HOWEVER, I LOVE it!  It really works out my body, especially my lower half, and challenges my muscles every time.  I wonder if the theory behind this "cardio" workout is that the major muscles are being worked and so the "cardio" effect comes AFTER the workout is done?! No idea.  Just speculations.Still, I highly suggest this workout along with Bob Harper's other Inside Out videos.  I suggest in fact following his 4 week plan that is in his website, starting off with workout out only 4 times a week the first week doing the shorter segments of the workouts in his 4 videos, working yourself up to the fourth week which is working out every day in the week.This video, along with his other workouts, are truly making a difference in my body and the best part is the reassurance that my body is really being worked out with good muscle aches after each workout.  If the workout eventually become too easy for you, I will kill you first from jealousy, but then I would suggest just increase the weight of the dumbbells.  Oh, and be sure to learn how to do the weight swings well.  If not done well, you will just have your lower back muscles sore instead of you glutes and legs.Good luck!
Title: N/A

reviewText: You don't get your heart rate as high as you should.  Low 300's burn.  The kettle bell swings are great and the 20 minute section works the legs out perfectly.
Title: N/A

reviewText: This is a different type of cardio. It starts out innocent enough but it then kicks your butt! My heart rate stayed high the entire time.it's good for weight loss without a lot of jumping around. I used it to train for a 5k to increase my endurance.  The moves are repetitive but it's still great. The participants seem to feel like giving up which actually motivated me!
Title: N/A

reviewText: I bought this DVD on a whim looking to change my normal workout routine that I had been doing. I really love Jillian Michaels DVD workouts, but Bob Harper's makes hers seem like it's for beginners! I figured since I workout 6 days a week that I could jump in and do the entire hour of this DVD. Boy, was I wrong! I barely made it to the 30 minute mark and thought I was going to pass out! It's non-stop cardio with dumb bell swings, suitcases, various hold positions, jump jacks, fast feet, etc. I highly recommend doing the 20 minute workout first on this DVD just to get you familiar with what's to come! I read some other reviews warning to beware that this hurts your lower back, that's only true because one has a weak core! This DVD focuses on strengthening one's core which a lot of other DVD's don't do. They only glimmer over it. Core is THE MOST IMPORTANT part of any workout, otherwise, you will have back pain! If you have ever done any Jillian DVD's or and P90X, or ShawnT, then this is for you to shake up your routine a bit! Glad I purchased this and I truly love doing this workout now as it has become a part of my weekly regimen.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I was very excited to try this one. I've been on the lookout for a really good cardio dvd and have been let down by Jillian Michaels' workouts. Despite the glowing reviews for her "Banish Fat, Boost Metabolism" saying how hard it was, I was very disappointed to find that it just wasn't that hard for me. I'm an upper intermediate level exerciser. THIS one was tough... and I loved it! I wouldn't recommend this for beginners, as there's not a lot of emphasis on correct form, and it's a very rigorous workout. I loved that the exercisers were very clearly working hard and not faking it. No perma smiles here. As much as I enjoy some of the Firm workouts, I get very tired of the Barbie dolls with the plastered on smiles pretending that the workout is tough for them. It was great to see the exercisers on this one truly work up a sweat and even have to stop sometimes. I loved the close up of Roxy's legs shaking during one of the held squats. Two days later, my hamstrings are still feeling it. And I found Bob to be a great motivator. There were a couple of moves that I modified because they're too hard on my knees, and there were a couple of places where I had to stop for a few seconds to take a breather. If you want to rev up your workout, this is a good one to try.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I found that I like this workout much more than Bob's Pure Burn Super Strength.  However, I found the dead lifts and squats very redundant in this video; it seems like you are doing them over and over again and it gets boring.  This workout does use weights, kind of like Bob's portion of Biggest Loser Cardio Maxx.  Bob is more easy going in this video that the Super Strength one, but not his old likeable self in the Biggest Loser videos.  The hour long portion gives you a great, sweaty workout.  The 20 minute video is more of a focus on glutes and balancing, not nearly as advanced as the longer workout. I would definately recommend this workout, but know that at times, it does get a bit boring and you may need to motivate yourself to push through it.

reviewText: O' my God!!!  What a workout! I could only workout for 30 minutes of the 60 minute routine. I'm healthy and had complete muscle failure after 30 minutes. Even 2 hours after the workout I was still in muscle failure and wondered if could get up the next morning for work. This is a great workout if you do it correctly as Bob describes. One of the best workouts.  Money well spent!!!!

reviewText: OK. So, I was stoked to get this due to all the positive reviews. Just received it today, and immediately started it. The first thing I notice is that all of his assistants have horrible form. Sloppy, half asked attempts at doing the exercises. Next, I was expecting it to be a hardcore CARDIO workout. This is not cardio. The majority of the moves are squats and deadlifts. Everything is done using weights, which makes this more strength training than cardio. Next, this is not quite a beginners exercise video, but it is definitely not for the advanced or seasoned excersiser. I was incredibly disappointed and will not be buying any more of his videos.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Two months ago I decided it's time to get back into shape.  I started out with Jililian Michael videos yet wanted a bit of "diversity" in my workouts.  After trying Jeanette Jenkins bootcamp videos and being just okay with it, I came across Bob Harper stuff via amazon.  For the most part his videos got really good reviews, especially this Cardio Rev conditioning.  I was excited to workout hard and looked forward to the video.After the warm up and a bit of boxing moves, it goes straight into squats...and STAYS into squats for damn near 30minutes before any other moves are incorporated.  Squats with dumbbell swings.  After a while, the squats and dumbbell swings just KILLED MY BACK.  I couldn't do anymore swings after 15minutes but couldn't take ANY MORE squats for 30 min.Luckily, I only paid $7 for this video and will just consider it a loss.  I agree with other customers who say it's boring, repetitive, and bad for the back. I think I'll just stick with Jillian Michaels.
summary: Repetitive, boring, and bad for the back
Title: N/A

reviewText: Another great workout from Bob Harper. Definitely not for a beginner but not as hard as his other cardio workout "Ultimate Cardio Body" but still intense to make a seasoned exerciser stop a minute. My only issue is the length; 62 minutes of intense workout is not easy. By the 40 minute mark, I am so exhausted I am ready to be done. However I must add that after 40 mins, you feel like you just got a great workout.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I have been doing a combo of 5 Jillian M. videos and 2 Jackie W. videos for about 3 weeks now, so I wanted to up the stakes. I bought this video and it kicked my booty. I was able to get through the 1 hour cardio but I was not able to do all the reps and I had to add a few small water breaks but I did get through it. I imagine that at my current strength I would need to do this video several times before I could fully do all the exercises and reps. I was soaked afterward and I like that the moves are not complicated. They are very straight forward moves with high rep. The only down I see w/ this video is that the shorter video bonus is not cardio rather lower body.I was hoping for a more compact version of the  1 hr cardio as an alternate on days I can't spend 1 hour working out. Good addition to any Jillian and Jackie fans. In my opinion the style on this video is close to P90x , even in terms of how they do the camera work.  If you are just starting out this might be overwhelming, in which case I say try to do at least 1/2 the video or lower the reps to get through the full hour. Also , warning you may experience lower back pain (I think from all the squats and swings) the following day, so do not plan on a big workout after you try this for the first time.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I love Bob Harper.  I love how he teaches and love him on Biggest Loser.  This DVD was hard.  So hard I didn't get through a fourth of it.  Back to Jillilan until I can get in shape enough to do it.  A little hard on my knees, but as the weight comes off I am sure it will get easier!
Title: N/A

reviewText: This workout is hard. You will sweat a lot.  It is made for people who want to lose a lot of weight and also for people that want to get toned.  Bob is tough, he's not going to give any breaks.  If you want a workout that will help you lose weight, try this one out.  I've done lots of his workouts and this is the best one.  You will need some hand weights.  For women I suggest 5-8 pounds.
Title: N/A

reviewText: This is a fairly intense workout that is aimed towards intermediate to advanced exercisers. This workout uses one heavy weight and a set of light weights. This is a challenging workout in terms of the level of fitness required.  This workout is not appropriate for beginners because there is very little instruction given in regards to form and some of the exercises require proper form to avoid injury (ie. deadlifts).  There is also a lot of exercises in which you are swinging a handweight and these could cause injury to someone who is still in the process of building sufficient core strength.  This workout also has a lot of squats so if you have knee issues, you may want to pass on this one.This is a workout that does not require a "learning curve" (no complicated dance routines to memorize).  The exercises included are mostly fairly basic (mountain climbers, jumping jackets, squat jumps, etc.). There is not a lot of creativity with the exercises chosen or their arrangement so at times, the routine seems to drag (thus the 4 star rating).  That said, it was a very effective cardio workout.  The workout is designed so that heart rate goes very high then it comes down again.  This pattern is repeated multiple times during the workout. The warm-up is sufficiently long and then the intensity builds.  A countdown clock is present on the video at all times which is a feature I happen to like.This is an intense cardio workout that will get your heart pumping.  It is about the same level of intensity as Jillian's  Burn Fat Boost Metabolism and will appeal to people who like that style of workout.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I was so happy when Bob came out with this workout! I really wanted a challenge (like Jillian Michaels). Lets just say I couldn't workout for a week because my legs hurt so bad! It does make you sweat, but I could only do a half hour of this workout. I think it's a good workout, but it is a little much. Geezzz Bob...
Title: N/A

reviewText: I'm a huge fan of Bob Harper and have almost all of the Biggest Loser workout DVDs. This seemed to be more of a "hardcore" workout for those of us who are already in shape but want a challenge. I remembered reading reviews about the trainers in the workout being out of breath and fatigued, which makes me feel better about being tired throughout. It adds a sense of reality like they didn't take a bunch of breaks during the filming of this. There's also a countdown display throughout the whole workout so you know exactly how much time you have left. It's a little daunting at first to see that you have over an hour left on the clock, but it goes by pretty quickly. My ONLY complaint about this workout is that the majority of the moves involve bending over. I don't have back problems, but after 20 minutes of doing straight-leg bends with weights, my lower back is begging for a change. It feels like we are doing variations of that move or pushups forever, and my back distracts me from really feeling the workout the way I should. I really do like it, otherwise, because the movements are all simple but still challenging. Overall, another good Bob video to add to the collection!
summary: I love Bob, but my back does not!
Title: N/A

reviewText: This is a very, very hard workout but I love it.  Bob pushes and pushes and pushes until you think you just can't go on anymore at times.  Even the cast gets tired LOL.  The only negative I found is that the cast isn't in sync most of the time but that's trivial since I just focus on Bob and try not to pass out. I think it's funny when he says, "A ten-minute workout isn't a workout - it's a warm-up" ha ha.  I tend to agree but I must add that Jillian Michaels' 30-Day Shred and Jackie Warner's X-Treme Time-Saving workouts are only 20-30 minutes but they are no warm-up.  They are HARD.  Anyway, back to Bob's DVD.  When he says to pick up that dumbbell and swing it for the 100th time I just want to throw it at the tv.  For some reason those wear me out.  And those scorpion push-ups are crazy!!!  I'm just glad there aren't any burpees in this one because I hate them.  I highly recommend this for anyone who wants an intense workout with a very motivating trainer and a cast made up of REAL people who struggle to get through it too.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I'll be 60 in another few months and I can do this DVD. It's hard, no doubt about it. So if you're looking for easy, this is not the DVD for you !!  There are days when I'm not so vigorous but I just push myself working at a more comfortable pace.  More often, I can do the whole DVD by adjusting my workout level. But, many times I can complete this high intensity workout with no problem. Bob Harper gives you and excellent workout and really kicks you butt !! Great workout on these DVD's.
summary: An Excellent Workout For Those Who Want A Challenge !!
Title: N/A

reviewText: I typically like Jillian Michaels and Jackie Warner workout videos -- the no-nonsense kick butt style, without the cheesy choreography, so this video fits in there. I'm in great shape, I work out 5-6 days a week, and the hour long workout on here is a pretty good challenge. I liked Bob's fun personality on the biggest loser dvds, but he doesn't really have that fun, goofy thing going here. He's a little too militant on this DVD for me. The vibe is depressing and I actually usually ENJOY working out and have fun doing it. The filming style and colors of this dvd are so serious and dark that I'm just not as into it. And it kind of grosses me out when he gets all up on one of the girls doing the workout and is just a little too close and mean in this masochistic/sexual way. Get a room. That makes me a little uncomfortable. On the plus side, I like that they keep track of the time in the bottom corner. And the workout does get my heart rate up and bring muscles to fatigue. But I prefer fun Bob.
Title: N/A

reviewText: This is the first bob harper dvd I bought and don't regret a single penny spent. I love it. I couldn't get through the entire dvd the first try and now I do but it still gets me sweating and out of breath every time! Go for it if you desire a challenge for an at home workout!
Title: N/A

reviewText: Bob Harper is just as rough as Jillian Michaels, but his disposition is much softer.  With that being said, he is a wonderful trainer and is able to motivate someone even if you are just with him on your TV.  THis workout, however, is boarderline impossible to make it through.  This is ROUGH, and that deserves to be in all capital letters.  THis is so, so, SO hard you can't believe it.  I am in fairly good shape, even with modifications (such as not using weights for the squats, holding onto the side of a desk in the balance exercises, etc.), this will be vicious unlike anything you have ever experienced.  And I am talking about the beginner sequence.  Attempt the full workout, you will be physically and mentally ill by the time this is over.  This is for advanced workouts ONLY.  What would be much more helpful is to have the beginner segment be the intermediate segement and a true beginner sequence in the beginning.  THis is only for those who want a true challenge and are SERIOUS about a true challenge.  The majority of people are not ready for this, and might loose their motivation quickly.
Title: N/A

reviewText: First- I do like this workout. I find it intermediate and pretty challenging. My heart rate is up and I get huffed. However, despite having this workout for a while it hasn't become a weekly favorite although I pull it out once a month or so.The negatives : Bob doesn't do the workout and the exercisers often show poor form. Sometimes I found it difficult to figure out exactly what variation of an exercise we were supposed to do because they were all doing something a little different. I think if Bob isn't going to show you proper form, he should at least be correcting the demonstrators. And there's a segment when we're supposed to be holding a squat and they've all collapsed..... it's not that hard of a routine. I am 10-15 lbs overweight and reasonably fit and if I can do the dvd with good form and without all the facial contortions, moaning and groaning, why can't these super fit people? It seems like bad acting.  I think way too much time is spend doing the kettle ball style swings. there are 3 long sets of them and it does get rather boring and I also find it's easy to strain your lower back doing them if your form isn't perfect or you start with too much weight, not realizing there will be millions of them ahead...  I think someone new to exercise could easily injure themselves on this DVD. If, however you have a good basic knowledge I think you'd be fine.
summary: A good workout but with a few cons
Title: N/A

reviewText: "Bob Harper: Cardio Conditioning" DVD contains two workouts, the "Cardio Workout" (about 61 minutes) and the "Butt & Balance Workout" (about 24 minutes).  I did both workouts, with lots of modifications and short breaks.  When I first did this workout, I was exhausted, just like the three who demonstrate in the video.Cardio Workout is long and intense.  Heartbeat is up and sweat drips.  This contains some high impact moves (not for those with knee or foot issues), but you can modify.  One or two light dumbbells are used on some exercises.Here's the breakdown.Warm up is about 4 minutes, with light moves and stretches.Cool down is over 3 minutes, with stretches.Workout is about 54 minutes.  Below is a list of most of the exercises.PunchUpper cutDeadliftDeadlift rowDeadlift single arm rowSwingDeadliftSuitcase swingSquatSquat jumpSquat comboHand walkMountain climberPush upMountain climberPush upJumping jackWide squatJumping jackWide squatFast feetJump to twist comboSquat holdSwingDeadliftRack to overhead pressOverhead pressDeadliftRack to overhead pressSwingSuitcase swingSwingHandwalkScorpion push upKnee raise squatSpeed squatJump ropeOverhead pressJumping jackSwingPush upSpeed skaterMosh pit jumpTuck jumpSumo squatStanding ab workStanding oblique crunchCore twistIso front raiseSide plank raiseThe shorter workout, "Butt & Balance," actually has a lot of balance work; you may want to be next to a chair or wall, or put your hanging leg down.  Here's the breakdown.DeadliftSingle leg deadliftSingle leg rowFront leg liftSingle leg deadlift, other legSingle leg row, other legFront leg lift, other legSquatSingle leg lateral raiseSingle leg front shoulder raiseKick comboChair poseChair pulsesStretch cooldown
summary: A long, heart pumping, sweat dripping "Cardio Workout"

reviewText: I bought this dvd because I wanted an intense cardio workout that I could use in between days when I run. This is a serious workout. While doing the exercise I feel as if Bob is in the room with me.  It's like I have my own personal trainer.
summary: Better than going to a gym

reviewText: i have only done the 60 minute work out.  so note that.up to this point i've been active. doing Jillian MIchael's 30 day shred; no more trouble zones; yoga meltdown.  somethign of those fie to six days a week. I could keep up pretty well for the most part.  but i found myself getting bored.so when i found this dvd on clearance and knowing that he was the other evil trainer, i decided to give it a try.i popped it in, and what starts off as innocent, slightly challenging turns into an all out death drive.  Little did I know.you will work. HARD. HARDER than I thought possible on a workout dvd. you will be working out in a pool of sweat.I loved that the people behind Bob were struggling. It made me feel better to see these really in shape people about ready to keel over and die. at one point, one of the girls was miliseconds from tears.this is an excellent work out. i look forward to doing this more and more.It's a huge challenge, not geared for beginners by any means. But something to work up for.  A great work out.  worth every penny.  If you're serious about getting in shape, put this guy on your list.
summary: an evil taskmaster. hang on for the ride.  worth the money.

reviewText: Where do I start? I can run a 1/2 marathon, made it through Insanity and P90X. Wowza. I hate kettlebells and I hate mixed cardio and weights, but this is so frickin' intense I am totally addicted.

reviewText: This is my second Bob Harper video, the first being his "Yoga for the Warrior" video from this same series. The yoga one is a good one overall and is now in my rotation of favorite yoga videos.But that's another story. This one, "Body Rev Cardio Conditioning," is a fantastic workout that continues to kick my butt each time. The funny thing is, I had thought I was already in pretty good shape when I ordered this, having just completed P90X and being midway through P90X2. But Bob takes things to a whole new level and reminds me that there is always room for improvement.What I think I like best about this is the pacing. There are times when this routine gets really hard, as is evidenced not only by my own struggles but by those of the three participants in this video who--despite all being pretty fit--have to stop and catch their breath several times during the workout. (He jokes at one point that the man in the video "will probably puke when this is done," and I totally sympathize with the guy.)Fortunately, Bob generally seems to understand when it's time to back off a bit. And so just when I'm reaching the point where I don't think I'm going to be able to go on, he switches it up with something that's not as strenuous. That gives me just enough time to catch my breath and motivate myself to push it till the end.Let me add a warning, though: this video is NOT for beginners! Unless you are already in fairly good shape and have been exercising quite regularly, then you definitely should not start with this routine. Go instead for Bob's "Beginners Weight Loss" video or some other early-stage workout program that will help you build your way up to this one.I can't say enough about how much I like this video. I'd highly recommended it for any serious fitness enthusiast who is looking for something fun, energetic and demanding that will help them take things to the next level.

reviewText: This is a great exercise disc for intermediate to advanced level. It is 1 hour long so you need to have enough time to do the whole program. Of course, you can always stop after 30 minutes and you would still feel like you have done a good workout. The only thing part I do not care for with this program is when he makes you go into a squat hold at the end on a certain exercise routine. I fail to see the cardio benefit of a hold. I know it makes the routine tougher but it also makes your muscle aching and tired so you cannot perform the next routine with full intensity. I just skipped that part myself.

reviewText: This video is a fabulous addition to Bob Harper's other videos.  It incorporates weights with cardio in 30 second intervals.  You definately sweat through this workout. I purchased this video because recently I injured my knee running. I was forced to use walking as my exercise routine. As most runners know, its a poor substitute. So to get my heart rate up to the equivalant, I thought I'd try HIIT(High Intensity Interval Training). Let me just say this, we have a winner. I'm so impressed with Bob Harpers videos that I don't feel like I'm missing anything not running.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I am an advanced exerciser (female, 24) and decided to give this a shot due to the glowing reviews.I did find it to be a good workout but highly repetitive (you do about a million kettlebell-esque swings, think you are done with them, then go back to them again).  You will get a decent sweat, though this is not truly a cardio workout in the traditional sense.  Their is a lot of shoulder work included with light weights and a minute plus of pushups.  This may not appeal to people who break from strength training to do a cardio workout that is, well, strictly cardio.I thought the rock music would appeal to me more than it did.  It was too quiet and not 'hardcore' enough to go with the workout.  Two of the background exercisers could not keep up with the demands of the workout and were repeatedly modeling poor form.I will do this workout from time to time.  My husband noticed his lower back and legs were very sore in the following days so he wants to continue to do it to strengthen those muscle groups.

reviewText: I have been doing P90X for the past 2.5 years and love the results I have gotten.  However, I wanted to get a little more cardio which for me is a weak point of the P90x program.  I have been switching this routine in place of the plyo and it is a high intensity workout that gets my heart pounding which is what I want.  There are no breaks-I like that. I feel that I am working my muscles a bit differently than with P90X and I like that.  I especially like the core routine at the end of the 1 hour program.  I also love the 25 minute routine which focus on balance.  I've purchased several of Bob DVD and have switched them into my rotation of P90X.  Thank you.
Title: N/A

reviewText: This is my first Bob Harper DVD. I think I am an intermediate exerciser, working out 6 or 7 days a week for an hour at a time. This DVD is HARD, and will make you sore, especially in the thighs and hamstrings. Seriously. After the warmup, I think the first 10 minutes are just squats with different kettleball swings. Oh My Goodness. He does eventually move on to other stuff, my favorite being the mosh pit jumps. It reminds me of a class I used to take at the gym where the instructor would completely wear your arms out, then have you do over head work. It makes even light weights feel crazy heavy and your arms feel like lead. This is not a workout I would want to do 3x a week or anything, but for a good challenge once a week or so, this DVD would do the trick. One thing that I thought was awesome was the music. It's much more hard core than what you get on most workout DVD's. It's a great rock/metal sound with some recognizable songs, just no vocals. Vocals would probably take away from and distract you from the workout anyway. But it was nice to not have generic pop sounding music in the background.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I saw a lot of reviewers that did not like this because it was too tough and they were not in shape.  I will give you a background on me:  I exercise, but not as often as I should (more like when I find the time and I have the energy, about 1/3 of the amount I should be doing) and I am overweight by an amount I would rather keep to myself, but trust me, I am no size 10!!  I also have asthma.I absolutely love Bob's videos and even though I am out of shape and have to modify the moves A LOT, I can still do this workout.  You do not have to do every move the way the fitness pros on here do.  If the move is too tough, modify it to where it is comfortable, but just enough outside your comfort zone that you get a workout.  When I do this consistently, I do find that I have to modify less and am able to make it through the whole workout!!  The first few times I did stop for a break then went back into the video.  After a couple of weeks, I found I could complete the entire thing without any breaks.  My body started changing and I felt great.I did not keep going for my own personal lazy reasons, but plan to get right back into the series again.  I even got compliments that people started seeing a change in me even though the pounds have not come off that quickly yet.Please do not get discouraged by those who talk about how tough it is.  It is hard, but remember, go at your own pace and do what you know you can handle.  Modify when you have to and eventually you will not have to modify the moves anymore.This does change your body when you stick with it, even with the modifications and taking breaks when you need to.  As you get stronger, you will be able to do more and more of each video.  (Although, I don't see myself doing the "bird of paradise" move in his yoga dvd any time soon.  I was never graced with a lot of flexibility and do not expect to master that one!!!)
summary: great video, even if you are starting out
Title: N/A

reviewText: OMG ... this kicked my butt! I consider myself to be an intermediate to advanced level exerciser and have an extensive library of at home fitness products including P90X and Insanity as well as gym experience. I'm not really a Biggest Loser fan nor have I ever done any of Bob or Jillian's other programs.I liked what I saw on the video preview so decided to give it a try. I tried the cardio program for the first time and I was sweating and breathless in the first 10 minutes. Bob switches back between drills and light weights ~  most of the weighted  moves that he uses are good to use with a kettle bell although the participants use weights. I opted for a kettle bell since I'm used to them. And no while it is nothing new (is anything really?), the combination really raises your heart rate and works up a good sweat. Personally I did moves on here that though I've seen them, I haven't seen them on at home programs.I've been a huge fan of programs like P90X and Insanity. A program like P90x is an entire 90 day program and offers a variety of different workouts to keep you interested for that time frame. But he primarily focuses on strength training and offers 1 or 2 cardio workouts. Insanity is primarily high intensity cardio sports type drills. Like with anything else a few times through either of these programs and they can get a bit dull. Bob only offers 2 programs so far so I can see where it might start to get a little boring but if you mix it up with other things it shouldn't get stale. I'm personally looking forward to more like this to add to my library. It's nice to have a variety.

reviewText: I've done the Biggest Loser workouts over the years and while I found them to be mildly heartpumping, this one is soooo much better. I was skeptical, but got it anyway because it was on sale. I am glad I did. It's currently in weekly rotation next to my Insanity Dvds.The 1 hr workout really works your legs most. Lots of squats of various arrangements. My legs are normally a little sore after doing this workout. I'm loving it right now and will try the other Dvd in the same series.
